intro: Tabernaemontana breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered starflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes plants known for their milky sap and showy flowers. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped white or pink flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are typically ovate and arranged oppositely along the stems. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
